lines.text: Enter LADY CAPULET and Nurse

lines.speaker: lady capulet
lines.text: Hold, take these keys, and fetch more spices, nurse.

lines.speaker: nurse
lines.text: They call for dates and quinces in the pastry.
Enter CAPULET

lines.speaker: capulet
lines.text: Come, stir, stir, stir! the second cock hath crowd, The curfewbell hath rung, tis three oclock: Look to the baked meats, good Angelica: Spare not for the cost.

lines.speaker: nurse
lines.text: Go, you cotquean, go, Get you to bed faith, Youll be sick tomorrow For this nights watching.

lines.speaker: capulet
lines.text: No, not a whit: what! I have watchd ere now All night for lesser cause, and neer been sick.

lines.speaker: lady capulet
lines.text: Ay, you have been a mousehunt in your time But I will watch you from such watching now.
Exeunt LADY CAPULET and Nurse

lines.speaker: capulet
lines.text: A jealous hood, a jealous hood! Now, fellow, Whats there
Enter three or four Servingmen, with spits, logs, and baskets

lines.speaker: first servant
lines.text: Things for the cook, sir but I know not what.

lines.speaker: capulet
lines.text: Make haste, make haste. Sirrah, fetch drier logs: Call Peter, he will show thee where they are.
Exit First Servant

lines.speaker: second servant
lines.text: I have a head, sir, that will find out logs, And never trouble Peter for the matter.
Exit

lines.speaker: capulet
lines.text: Mass, and well said a merry whoreson, ha! Thou shalt be loggerhead. Good faith, tis day: The county will be here with music straight, For so he said he would: I hear him near. Nurse! Wife! What, ho! What, nurse, I say! Go waken Juliet, go and trim her up Ill go and chat with Paris: hie, make haste, Make haste the bridegroom he is come already: Make haste, I say.
Music within
Reenter Nurse
Exeunt
